info.title: FortiOS CMDB
info.description: REST API for configuring FortiOS objects and settings

get.summary:
Select a specific entry from a CLI table.
 Access Group: netgrp

action.description:
Permit or deny this IP address and netmask prefix.   
permit:Permit or allow this IP address and netmask prefix.   
deny:Deny this IP address and netmask prefix.

prefix.description: IPv4 prefix to define regular filter criteria, such as "any" or subnets.

wildcard.description: Wildcard to define Cisco-style wildcard filter criteria.

exact-match.description:
Enable/disable exact match.   
enable:Enable exact match.   
disable:Disable exact match.

400.description: Bad Request: Request cannot be processed by the API

401.description: Not Authorized: Request without successful login session

403.description: Forbidden: Request is missing CSRF token or administrator is missing access profile permissions.

404.description: Resource Not Found: Unable to find the specified resource.

405.description: Method Not Allowed: Specified HTTP method is not allowed for this resource.

413.description: Request Entity Too Large: Request cannot be processed due to large entity

424.description: Failed Dependency: Fail dependency can be duplicate resource, missing required parameter, missing required attribute, invalid attribute value

429.description: Access temporarily blocked: Maximum failed authentications reached. The offended source is temporarily blocked for certain amount of time.

500.description: Internal Server Error: Internal error when processing the request

parameters.name: attr
parameters.description: Attribute name that references other table

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

parameters.name: skip_to_datasource
parameters.description: Skip to provided table's Nth entry. E.g {datasource: 'firewall.address', pos: 10, global_entry: false}

parameters.name: acs
parameters.description: If true, returned result are in ascending order.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: If present, the objects will be filtered by the search value.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope [global|vdom|both*]

parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

parameters.name: with_meta
parameters.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
datasource: Return all applicable datasource entries for a specific attribute based on simulate data.
stats: Return CMDB aggregated statistics.
find-index: Return indexes of provided primary keys with respect to filter.
default: Return the CLI default values for this object type.
json-schema: Return the JSON Schema for this object type.
schema: Return the CLI schema for this object type.
revision: Return the CMDB revision for this object type.
transaction-list: List all configuration transaction(s).
transaction-show: Show the content of the configuration transaction by transcation ID.

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: mkey

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.

vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: mkey

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

7.name: format
7.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

8.name: filter
8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

9.name: key
9.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

10.name: pattern
10.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

13.name: datasource_format
13.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

14.name: skip_to
14.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

15.name: unfiltered_count
15.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

16.name: filter

.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

tag-resolve-mode.description:
Configure tag-match mode. Resolves BGP routes with other routes containing the same tag.   
disable:Disable tag-match mode.   
preferred:Use tag-match if a BGP route resolution with another route containing the same tag is successful.   
merge:Merge tag-match with best-match if they are using different routes. The result will exclude the next hops of tag-match whose interfaces or child interfaces have appeared in best-match.   
merge-all:Merge tag-match with best-match if they are using different routes. The result will exclude the next hops of tag-match whose interfaces have appeared in best-match.

distance-local.description: Distance for routes local to the AS.

disable:Disable setting.

8.name: filter
8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

26.name: vdom
26.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

8.name: filter
8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

10.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

get.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: netgrp

route-threshold.description: Generate warnings when the number of multicast routes exceeds this number, must not be greater than route-limit.

multicast-routing.description:
Enable/disable IP multicast routing.   
enable:Enable IP multicast routing.   
disable:Disable IP multicast routing.

message-interval.description: Period of time between sending periodic PIM join/prune messages in seconds (1 - 65535, default = 60).

accept-register-list.description: Sources allowed to register packets with this Rendezvous Point (RP).

accept-source-list.description: Sources allowed to send multicast traffic.

bsr-candidate.description:
Enable/disable allowing this router to become a bootstrap router (BSR).   
enable:Allow this router to function as a BSR.   
disable:Do not allow this router to function as a BSR.

bsr-interface.description: Interface to advertise as candidate BSR.

bsr-allow-quick-refresh.description:
Enable/disable accept BSR quick refresh packets from neighbors.   
enable:Allow quick refresh packets.   
disable:Do not allow quick refresh packets.

cisco-crp-prefix.description:
Enable/disable making candidate RP compatible with old Cisco IOS.   
enable:Do not allow sending group prefix of zero.   
disable:Allow sending group prefix of zero.

cisco-register-checksum.description:
Checksum entire register packet(for old Cisco IOS compatibility).   
enable:register checksum entire packet.   
disable:Do not register checksum entire packet.

cisco-register-checksum-group.description: Cisco register checksum only these groups.

cisco-ignore-rp-set-priority.description:
Use only hash for RP selection (compatibility with old Cisco IOS).   
enable:Ignore RP-SET priority value.   
disable:Do not ignore RP-SET priority value.

register-rp-reachability.description:
Enable/disable check RP is reachable before registering packets.   
enable:Check target RP is unicast reachable before registering.   
disable:Do not check RP unicast reachability.

register-source.description:
Override source address in register packets.   
disable:Use source address of RPF interface.   
interface:Use primary IP of an interface.   
ip-address:Use a local IP address.

register-supression.description: Period of time to honor register-stop message (1 - 65535 sec, default = 60).

null-register-retries.description: Maximum retries of null register (1 - 20, default = 1).

rp-register-keepalive.description: Timeout for RP receiving data on (S,G) tree (1 - 65535 sec, default = 185).

spt-threshold.description:
Enable/disable switching to source specific trees.   
enable:Switch to Source tree when available.   
disable:Do not switch to Source tree when available.

spt-threshold-group.description: Groups allowed to switch to source tree.

ssm.description:
Enable/disable source specific multicast.   
enable:Allow source specific multicast.   
disable:Do not allow source specific multicast.

ssm-range.description: Groups allowed to source specific multicast.

register-rate-limit.description: Limit of packets/sec per source registered through this RP (0 - 65535, default = 0 which means unlimited).

pim-use-sdwan.description:
Enable/disable use of SDWAN when checking RPF neighbor and sending of REG packet.   
enable:Enable use of SDWAN when checking RPF neighbor and sending of REG packet.   
disable:Disable use of SDWAN when checking RPF neighbor and sending of REG packet.

bsr-candidate.description:
Enable/disable allowing this router to become a bootstrap router (BSR).   
enable:Allow this router to function as a BSR.   
disable:Do not allow this router to function as a BSR.

bsr-interface.description: Interface to advertise as candidate BSR.

bsr-allow-quick-refresh.description:
Enable/disable accept BSR quick refresh packets from neighbors.   
enable:Allow quick refresh packets.   
disable:Do not allow quick refresh packets.

cisco-crp-prefix.description:
Enable/disable making candidate RP compatible with old Cisco IOS.   
enable:Do not allow sending group prefix of zero.   
disable:Allow sending group prefix of zero.

ttl-threshold.description: Minimum TTL of multicast packets that will be forwarded (applied only to new multicast routes) (1 - 255, default = 1).

passive.description:
Enable/disable listening to IGMP but not participating in PIM.   
enable:Listen only.   
disable:Participate in PIM.

bfd.description:
Enable/disable Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD).   
enable:Enable Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD).   
disable:Disable Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD).

hello-interval.description: Interval between sending PIM hello messages (0 - 65535 sec, default = 30).

hello-holdtime.description: Time before old neighbor information expires (0 - 65535 sec, default = 105).

cisco-exclude-genid.description:
Exclude GenID from hello packets (compatibility with old Cisco IOS).   
enable:Do not send GenID.   
disable:Send GenID according to standard.

propagation-delay.description: Delay flooding packets on this interface (100 - 5000 msec, default = 500).

state-refresh-interval.description: Interval between sending state-refresh packets (1 - 100 sec, default = 60).

rp-candidate.description:
Enable/disable compete to become RP in elections.   
enable:Compete for RP elections.   
disable:Do not compete for RP elections.

rp-candidate-group.description: Multicast groups managed by this RP.

rp-candidate-interval.description: RP candidate advertisement interval (1 - 16383 sec, default = 60).

static-group.description: Statically set multicast groups to forward out.

rpf-nbr-fail-back.description:
Enable/disable fail back for RPF neighbor query.   
enable:Enable fail back for RPF neighbor query.   
disable:Disable fail back for RPF neighbor query.

rpf-nbr-fail-back-filter.description: Filter for fail back RPF neighbors.

access-group.description: Groups IGMP hosts are allowed to join.

version.description:
Maximum version of IGMP to support.   
3:Version 3 and lower.   
2:Version 2 and lower.   
1:Version 1.

immediate-leave-group.description: Groups to drop membership for immediately after receiving IGMPv2 leave.

last-member-query-interval.description: Timeout between IGMPv2 leave and removing group (1 - 65535 msec, default = 1000).

last-member-query-count.description: Number of group specific queries before removing group (2 - 7, default = 2).

query-max-response-time.description: Maximum time to wait for a IGMP query response (1 - 25 sec, default = 10).

query-interval.description: Interval between queries to IGMP hosts (1 - 65535 sec, default = 125).

query-timeout.description: Timeout between queries before becoming querying unit for network (60 - 900, default = 255).

router-alert-check.description:
Enable/disable require IGMP packets contain router alert option.   
enable:Require Router Alert option in IGMP packets.   
disable:don't require Router Alert option in IGMP packets

ssm-range.description: Groups allowed to source specific multicast.

register-rate-limit.description: Limit of packets/sec per source registered through this RP (0 - 65535, default = 0 which means unlimited).

pim-use-sdwan.description:
Enable/disable use of SDWAN when checking RPF neighbor and sending of REG packet.   
enable:Enable use of SDWAN when checking RPF neighbor and sending of REG packet.   
disable:Disable use of SDWAN when checking RPF neighbor and sending of REG packet.

bsr-candidate.description:
Enable/disable allowing this router to become a bootstrap router (BSR).   
enable:Allow this router to function as a BSR.   
disable:Do not allow this router to function as a BSR.

bsr-interface.description: Interface to advertise as candidate BSR.

bsr-allow-quick-refresh.description:
Enable/disable accept BSR quick refresh packets from neighbors.   
enable:Allow quick refresh packets.   
disable:Do not allow quick refresh packets.

cisco-crp-prefix.description:
Enable/disable making candidate RP compatible with old Cisco IOS.   
enable:Do not allow sending group prefix of zero.   
disable:Allow sending group prefix of zero.

ttl-threshold.description: Minimum TTL of multicast packets that will be forwarded (applied only to new multicast routes) (1 - 255, default = 1).

passive.description:
Enable/disable listening to IGMP but not participating in PIM.   
enable:Listen only.   
disable:Participate in PIM.

bfd.description:
Enable/disable Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD).   
enable:Enable Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD).   
disable:Disable Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD).

hello-interval.description: Interval between sending PIM hello messages (0 - 65535 sec, default = 30).

hello-holdtime.description: Time before old neighbor information expires (0 - 65535 sec, default = 105).

cisco-exclude-genid.description:
Exclude GenID from hello packets (compatibility with old Cisco IOS).   
enable:Do not send GenID.   
disable:Send GenID according to standard.

propagation-delay.description: Delay flooding packets on this interface (100 - 5000 msec, default = 500).

state-refresh-interval.description: Interval between sending state-refresh packets (1 - 100 sec, default = 60).

rp-candidate.description:
Enable/disable compete to become RP in elections.   
enable:Compete for RP elections.   
disable:Do not compete for RP elections.

rp-candidate-group.description: Multicast groups managed by this RP.

rp-candidate-interval.description: RP candidate advertisement interval (1 - 16383 sec, default = 60).

static-group.description: Statically set multicast groups to forward out.

rpf-nbr-fail-back.description:
Enable/disable fail back for RPF neighbor query.   
enable:Enable fail back for RPF neighbor query.   
disable:Disable fail back for RPF neighbor query.

rpf-nbr-fail-back-filter.description: Filter for fail back RPF neighbors.

access-group.description: Groups IGMP hosts are allowed to join.

version.description:
Maximum version of IGMP to support.   
3:Version 3 and lower.   
2:Version 2 and lower.   
1:Version 1.

immediate-leave-group.description: Groups to drop membership for immediately after receiving IGMPv2 leave.

last-member-query-interval.description: Timeout between IGMPv2 leave and removing group (1 - 65535 msec, default = 1000).

last-member-query-count.description: Number of group specific queries before removing group (2 - 7, default = 2).

query-max-response-time.description: Maximum time to wait for a IGMP query response (1 - 25 sec, default = 10).

query-interval.description: Interval between queries to IGMP hosts (1 - 65535 sec, default = 125).

query-timeout.description: Timeout between queries before becoming querying unit for network (60 - 900, default = 255).

router-alert-check.description:
Enable/disable require IGMP packets contain router alert option.   
enable:Require Router Alert option in IGMP packets.   
disable:don't require Router Alert option in IGMP packets

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.

Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.

8.name: filter
8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

8.name: filter
8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.
